title: Redgauntlet: A Tale Of The Eighteenth Century
author: Scott, Walter

title: Royal Edinburgh; Her Saints, Kings, Prophets and Poets
author: Oliphant, Mrs. (Margaret)
snippet: George Buchanan accordingly followed the Laird's flag upon one of thewildest and most fruitless of Albany's expeditions to the Border, forthe siege of Wark.

title: Royal Edinburgh; Her Saints, Kings, Prophets and Poets
author: Oliphant, Mrs. (Margaret)
snippet: George Buchanan accordingly followed the Laird's flag upon one of thewildest and most fruitless of Albany's expeditions to the Border, forthe siege of Wark.

title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: All the Four Lochs, we understand, are there still ; but the Little Loch transmogrified into an auxiliar appurtenance to some cursed Wark — the Brother Loch much exhausted by daily drains upon him by we know not what ^\Tetch — the White Loch lurched — and the Black Loch of a ghastly blue, cruelly cultivated all close round the brim.

title: Oliver Cromwell's letters and speeches: with elucidations.
author: Cromwell, Oliver
snippet: Oliver, in the beginning of1643, is serving there, under the Lord Gray of Wark.

title: Oliver Cromwell's letters and speeches: with elucidations.
author: Cromwell, Oliver
snippet: Ofwhich 'Associations,' countable to the number of five or six,we name only one, that of Norfolk, Suffolk, Essex, Cambridge,Herts ; with Lord Gray of Wark for Commander ; where, andunder whom, Oliver was now serving.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: He speedily possessed himself of the Border fortressesof Norham, Wark, Etall, Ford, and others of lessnote, and collected a great spoil.
